column4: hello, after intalling Ubuntu 11.04, I get "autochk not found" when i try to boot into Vista and the machine restarts, any help, please?
I think that is a vista problem, did you install Ubuntu without resizing Vista first?
yes, it happens now after I've reinstalled Ubuntu
I didn't resize anything
you had a unallocated area for Ubuntu?
I had an ext4 partiton
so vista choice is going back ti the grub menu?
yes
I woluld try a sudo update-grub in ubuntu, if that doesn't work a chkdsk in vista using a recovery or istall to get to the repair console.
ok, ty
did you remove any vista partitions?
no
cool check that the bootflag is on the right partition for vista with gparted in Ubutu, as well
I've tried the boot flag on both my windows and ubuntu partition an no difference... where should the boot flag actually be?
without seeing the boot script I don't kmow not on ubuntu that is for sure.
http://bootinfoscript.sourceforge.net/
did you over write it?
no
just installed ubuntu instead of debian
sonds like you did, t wont boot and fdisk -l shows it as linux
it mounts perfectly fine in ubuntu and works fine... as ntfs
I can access all the files
run the bootscript and pastebin the RSULTS.txt
ok, a sec, trying something...
